html:
For they call themselves of of the holy city, and stay themselves upon the God of Israel: The Lord of hosts is his name. (Isaiah 48:2.) Nevertheless, they call themselves of the holy city, but they do not stay themselves upon the God of Israel, who is the Lord of Hosts; yea, the Lord of Hosts is his name. (1 Ne. 20:2.)

The Book of Mormon retains the words "but they do not," which help us see the apostate conditions of Judah. It also retains the phrase "who is the Lord of Hosts" to further identify or describe the God of Israel, but this does not add meaning to the text.
